FuncDef:
The nat gratuitous-arp send auto command enables a device to send gratuitous ARP packets.
The undo nat gratuitous-arp send auto command disables a device from sending gratuitous ARP packets.
The function is disabled by default.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a CGN public IP address and the public network-side interface address are on the same network segment and the CGN cold backup status changes, to rapidly update ARP information, run the nat gratuitous-arp send auto command on a network-side interface to send gratuitous ARP packets once the interface goes Up.
Precautions
This function can be configured on a maximum of 256 interfaces. This function cannot be configured on QinQ termination sub-interfaces, dot1q termination sub-interfaces, super VLAN interfaces, and flexible access sub-interfaces.
